Key Match Events: Jose Iglesias hit a leadoff homer in the first inning
Alec Bohm blasted a three-run homer in the fourth inning
J.T. Realmuto crushed a two-run homer in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets played a fifth straight game without Francisco Lindor, who is sidelined with lower back soreness
Jose Iglesias continued his sizzling play with a hitting streak of 14 games
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza said he thought the second time through the lineup the Phillies were putting together some really good at-bats
Mendoza noted that the Mets scored 10 runs in three straight games before Friday's loss
Lindor said he still believes in what the Mets have and wants to be there for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies clinched a postseason berth for a third straight year with Friday's win
A victory Saturday or Sunday would allow the Phillies to celebrate winning the NL East title before leaving Queens
Eddy Alvarez was enlisted to pitch the ninth and worked a scoreless inning, eliciting chants of 'Ed-dy, Ed-dy' from the crowd
Others: Pete Alonso botched a pop-up in the loss on Friday night
J.D. Martinez went hitless in three at-bats and extended his drought to 0-for-31
